thread.title: Chino Valley football wins

title: Chino Valley football wins
text: Chino Valley football wins Courtesy photo/Yvonne MillsThe top 10 individual finishers in the 2015 Yavapai County Cross-Country Championships� girls� race Oct. 23 at Embry-Riddle in Prescott, from left: winner Makennah Mills of Prescott; runner-up Carissa Mills of Prescott; third-place Anna Zea of Bradshaw Mountain; fourth-place Becca Tupper of Chino Valley; fifth-place Maggie Dunkel of Prescott; sixth-place Chloe Vallejo of Chino Valley; seventh-place Swayze Smith of Prescott; eighth-place Lacy Dobbins of Prescott; and 10th-place Lizzy Tupper of Chino Valley. Not pictured: ninth-place finisher Katie Townsend of Prescott. win 2015 Yavapai CountyChampionships (Fri.)Prescott High girls' runner Makennah Mills took first place at the 2015 Yavapai County Cross-Country Championships Friday, Oct. 23, guiding the Badgers to the team title at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University.Mills won the 3.1-mile race - moved to Friday due to lightning on Oct. 21 - in 21 minutes and 35 seconds. Her time was a minute and a half faster than runner-up and fellow PHS teammate, Carissa Evans (23:01).Maggie Dunkel (fifth, 23:58), Swayze Smith (seventh, 24:20), Lacy Dobbins (eighth, 24:47) and Katie Townsend (ninth, 24:48) also placed in the Top 10 for the Badgers.Bradshaw freshman Anna Zea crossed the finish line in third (23:31), and Bears coach Mike Simon said it was a breakthrough race for her.Prescott compiled 21 first-place points, followed by runner-up Chino Valley (39 points). Becca Tupper paced the Cougars by finishing fourth in 23:38. Chino's Chloe Vallejo (sixth, 24:17) and Lizzy Tupper (10th, 25:11) also played key roles.On the boys' side, Bradshaw Mountain captured the team championship with 42 points. Prescott (second, 46 points), Mingus Union (third, 47) and Chino Valley (fourth, 91) followed.Sedona Red Rock and Wickenburg's boys' and girls' teams chose not to travel back to Prescott on Friday after the meet was rescheduled, Simon said. Mingus' girls' team, which is strong, also did not show.Individually for the boys, Mingus' Joseph Sandoval won the race in 18 minutes flat. And yet the Bears proved they possessed the most depth, claiming the county crown on the strength of runner-up Alex Villagran (18:14), David Villagran (fourth, 18:34), Emilio Mendibles (ninth, 19:32), Ricky Ayala (13th, 19:48.46) and Eddie Miner (14th, 19:48.81).In 2014, the Bears' boys placed third as a team in a tight race with a spread of only 6 points between the first- and third-place squads."It was a highly competitive race (on Friday), as it has been in the past," Simon said.Prescott was led by John McMahon (fifth, 18:48) and Bryan Evans (eighth, 19:29).With the 2015 regular season in the books, Prescott and Bradshaw Mountain's boys' and girls' teams will compete in the Division II, Section I meet Friday, Oct. 30, at Rose Mofford Sports Complex in Surprise. Simon said the top half of the teams in D-II, after sectionals, will qualify to run at state. Individually, the top 25 runners in each section also advance. Chino Valley will race in the Division III, Section II meet Oct. 30, in Holbrook.The D-II and D-III state meets will follow Saturday, Nov. 7, at Cave Creek Golf Course in Phoenix.PREP FOOTBALLChino Valley 41Mohave Accelerated 10 (Fri.)Chino Valley High's football team won its second straight game, pounding Mohave Accelerated on Senior Night Friday, Oct. 23, at home.With the victory, the Cougars improved their record to 4-5 overall and 2-2 in Division V, Section III.Chino will play its 2015 section/season finale against unbeaten section front-runner Joy Christian Thursday, Oct. 29. Kickoff is slated for 7 p.m. at North Canyon High in Phoenix.
